text:
Can you read through this email from the bottom up and see if you can understand
it. 
Apparently a recent MS update fails to install because either the Recovery
partition is too small or on the wrong side of the drive or doesn’t exist at
all. 
Here is my drive configuration on my Win 11 box. 
[cid:image002.png@01DA4966.9B8864F0] 
The update did not fail on my Win 11 box. 
Here is my Win 10 
[cid:image001.png@01DA4966.DB6BFC30] 
And the update did fail because there isn’t a Recovery partition on the drive. 
Thanks, 
Jim 
[cid:McAndrews-Logo_b981f23b-af61-4e79-9eb1-f721417fba3e.PNG]

Jim Boettger
Manager, Information Technology Group
McAndrews, Held & Malloy, Ltd.
500 W. Madison St., 34th floor | Chicago, IL 60661
P: 312-775-8000 

website

_

dissemination, distribution or copying of this material is prohibited. If you
received this message in error, please notify the sender by replying to this
message and then deleting it from your system. Your cooperation is appreciated.

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Feedback to Microsoft
